title: 111_s2918
content: The "Helping Small Business Succeed Act of 2009" increases maximum loan amounts under the 7(a) program to $4,875,000 and under the 504 program to $5,000,000. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to increase maximum loan amounts under the 504 program to $5,500,000. Additionally, maximum loan limits under the microloan program are addressed. SEC. 4 amends the Small Business Act to increase maximum loan limits under the microloan program from $35,000 to $50,000. Section 7(a)(2)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to change the loan percentage from 97.5 percent to 75 percent or 85 percent based on the outstanding balance at the time of disbursement. The loan disbursement balance must be less than or equal to $150,000. An amendment changes the loan percentage from 97.5 percent to 75 percent or 85 percent based on the outstanding balance. SEC. 6. Extension of Fee Reductions to October 3, 2011 for the Business Loans Program Account under the Small Business Administration in the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. SEC. 7. Economic disaster loans. The Small Business Administration can provide loans to small businesses in economic disaster areas under the same terms as regular loans. An economic disaster area is defined by low per capita income and high unemployment rates. The Small Business Administration can provide loans to small businesses in economic disaster areas with high unemployment rates. The authority to make these loans will end on October 3, 2011. SEC. 8. FUNDING. The curr_chunk discusses amending the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to transfer revenues from troubled assets sales to the Small Business Administration for the Helping Small Business Succeed Act of 2009. Under section 106(d) of the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008, as amended, funds are authorized to be appropriated for carrying out the Act and its amendments.
